terms.definition: A centralized software system that helps organizations create, store, organize, and maintain their technical documents and knowledge resources.
A system that tracks and manages changes to documents over time, allowing teams to see revision history and ensure everyone works with the latest version.
A chronological record of all changes, access, and modifications made to documents, providing accountability and compliance tracking.
Food and Drug Administration - the U.S. federal agency responsible for regulating medical devices, drugs, and other health-related products.
International Organization for Standardization - a global body that develops and publishes international standards for various industries.
A comprehensive compilation of records that describes the design history of a finished medical device, required by FDA regulations.
A compilation of records containing the procedures and specifications for a finished medical device, serving as the official documentation for manufacturing.
The ongoing monitoring of medical devices after they are released to market to ensure continued safety and effectiveness.
Groups of people with different functional expertise working together toward a common goal, such as engineers, regulatory specialists, and quality control staff.
The process of ensuring that products, services, and business practices adhere to relevant laws, regulations, and industry standards.
The systematic control of documents throughout their lifecycle, including creation, storage, retrieval, sharing, and archival.
The ability for multiple users to work on and edit documents simultaneously, with changes visible to all participants instantly.
European Medicines Agency - the regulatory body responsible for the evaluation and supervision of medicines and medical devices in the European Union.
The ability of a medical device or material to perform with an appropriate host response when placed in contact with living tissue.
A formalized system that documents processes, procedures, and responsibilities for achieving quality policies and objectives in an organization.
